result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Motion to forfeit bail granted.
Returned original warrant from the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department for Jasper J. Tye issued on 05-09-2022 by Judge J. Arthur Melvin, III.

BRANCH 5 ONLY WARRANT
Ext Code 3
Waukesha County Case 20CF1645

10:39 AM Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson in court.   
Defendant Jasper J Tye did not appear.   

Case set for plea and sentencing at 10:30 am and called at 10:39 am.  
Court notes WCS informed the Court the defendant removed his GPS monitor and a warrant was issued on May 9, 2022 when the defendant failed to appear in Court.
State requests a branch 5 only capias be issued.
Court will quash the current capias and issue a Branch 5 ONLY warrant.

Case called at 9:54AM 
Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson in court.   Defendant Jasper J Tye did not appear.

Case called at 11:25 AM
Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jasper J Tye in court with attorney Paul Garland Bonneson.  
Attorney Bonneson requests a different date for plea/sentencing.  Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 10:30 am.
To be forwarded to WCS for supervision fees.

CONDITIONS:
Defendant to have no contact with individuals listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.
Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

Case called at 10:39 AM

Defendant Jasper J Tye in court with attorney Paul Garland Bonneson.  
Court addresses the non-compliance with WCS.
Attorney Bonneson requests that the Cash Bail be sent to WCS for fees.
Court will MODIFY the CASH BAIL to $250.00 and the BALANCE of $316.00 is to be sent to WCS for fees due.
